content: tulle scrubbies this dish scrubbie is going to become your go to scrubbie made with tulle it cleans very effectively and it can be used for getting most things clean you don t have to worry about being too rough with it i ve used mine for over a year without any issues i love to give these little scrubbies as gifts to be used as a helpful cleaning aid about this pattern these scrubbies are made up of two circles that are seamed together with a slip_stitch these are incredibly quick to make using a large hook and tulle you can make a couple in less than an hour there is one size given that is about the standard scrubbie size you will notice that there is no gauge given as gauge is not important in this pattern this pattern is beginner friendly using basic stitches and it includes a photo tutorial which is at the end of the pattern materials ● a 6 roll of tulle 25 yds that looks like this i recommend buying this brand each scrubbie uses half a roll so you can make two out of one roll 1 ● 9mm hook ● scissors ● yarn needle for weaving in ends abbreviations* us terms but here is a link to convert them to uk terms round s round s st s stitch es slip_stitch slip_stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet stitch ws wrong side rs right side magic_ring magic_ring here is a video on how to make one *note abbreviations mean the same thing whether capitalized or not start crocheting here rnd1 rs ● make a magic_ring and chain 1* work 12 half_double_crochet into the ring and slip_stitch into the top of the first half_double_crochet to close you have 12 sts *note chain 1 doesn t count as a st here and throughout the pattern rnd2 rs ● chain 1 and work two half_double_crochet into every st around slip_stitch into the top of the first half_double_crochet to join you have 24 sts cut yarn leaving a 6 tail and pull it through the loop on your hook when you make the second circle do not cut the yarn make two ● follow the same instructions as listed above rnd1 and rnd2 to make another circle you will be joining these two circles together make sure you weave in all your ends before you join them seaming ● once you have finished both circles and the ends are woven in take the two circles and hold them so the ws is facing each other so each side you can see is the rs slip_stitch into each st of both sides* lining up the sts make sure you slip_stitch into both the loops once 2 you have finished seaming all the way around cut your yarn leaving a 6 tail and pull through the loop on your hook ● *note if you are still having trouble after looking at the photo tutorial this video can help you with this
